awd_abstract_narration: Shared computer resources among the departments of Biology,                Chemistry, Computer Science, and Mathematics are providing                      students with an important simulated laboratory environment.                    Thirty-five computer workstations are being utilized in a                       teaching laboratory to provide students with hands-on experience                which for reasons of cost, safety, or ethics cannot always be                   provided in traditional undergraduate laboratory settings.  A                   science computing laboratory also provides students with                        opportunities for self-directed experimentation and learning.                   The shared resources enhance the curriculum of both science                     majors as well as introductory courses of non-science majors.                                                                                                        This award is being matched by an equal sum from the                       grantee.

inst.inst_name: CANISIUS UNIVERSITY OF BUFFALO NEW YORK
